content.text: A set of symbolic safe area regions.
The safe area defined by the device and containers within the user interface, including elements such as top and bottom bars.
The safe area matching the current extent of any software keyboard displayed over the view content.

Shows the specified content beside the modified view.

pages.pageSummary: This is the Apple Developer Documentation page for the SafeAreaRegions structure in SwiftUI. It documents a frozen struct that represents a set of symbolic safe area regions, available across all Apple platforms (iOS 14.0+, iPadOS 14.0+, Mac Catalyst 14.0+, macOS 11.0+, tvOS 14.0+, visionOS 1.0+, watchOS 7.0+). The page details three static properties: 'all' (all safe area regions), 'container' (device and UI container boundaries like top/bottom bars), and 'keyboard' (software keyboard extent). It also shows protocol conformances and related methods for managing safe areas in SwiftUI views.

crossPageElements.runningFooters: Copyright 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows standard Apple Developer Documentation structure: header navigation, left sidebar with hierarchical API navigation, main content area with type declaration, topics (properties), relationships (protocol conformances), and see-also references, concluding with a comprehensive site footer.

keyTerms.definition: A frozen struct in SwiftUI that represents a set of symbolic safe area regions used for layout management.
The portion of a view's bounds that is not obscured by bars, rounded corners, or other system UI elements.
A Swift attribute indicating the struct's stored properties are fixed and cannot change in future versions, enabling compiler optimizations.
A safe area region defined by the device and UI containers like navigation bars and tab bars.
A safe area region matching the extent of any software keyboard displayed over view content.
A Swift protocol that SafeAreaRegions conforms to, allowing combination of multiple safe area regions.

keyFindings: SafeAreaRegions is available on all Apple platforms starting from iOS 14.0, iPadOS 14.0, Mac Catalyst 14.0, macOS 11.0, tvOS 14.0, visionOS 1.0, and watchOS 7.0.
The struct provides three predefined regions: .all (all regions), .container (device and UI container boundaries), and .keyboard (software keyboard area).
SafeAreaRegions conforms to OptionSet, enabling bitwise combination of multiple regions.
The struct is marked @frozen, indicating its ABI is stable and optimizations can be applied.
Related view modifiers include ignoresSafeArea, safeAreaInset, and safeAreaPadding for managing view layout relative to safe areas.

staticProperties.name: container
staticProperties.description: The safe area defined by the device and containers within the user interface, including elements such as top and bottom bars.

staticProperties.name: keyboard
staticProperties.description: The safe area matching the current extent of any software keyboard displayed over the view content.

relatedAPIs.description: Adds the provided insets into the safe area of this view.

designDecisions.rationale: Indicates ABI stability, allowing compiler to optimize by knowing the struct's layout won't change in future OS versions.
Enables combining multiple safe area regions using set operations (e.g., [.container, .keyboard]) for flexible safe area management.

designDecisions.decision: Separation of container and keyboard regions
designDecisions.rationale: Allows developers to independently control how views respond to different types of safe area insets - structural UI elements vs. dynamic keyboard.

sidebarNavigation.description: Left sidebar contains hierarchical navigation for SwiftUI documentation with expandable sections and icon-prefixed items
